metadata.title: CVE-2016-5637 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The restore_tqb_pixels function in libbpg 0.9.5 through 0.9.7 mishandlesthe transquant_bypass_enable_flag value, which allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write)via a crafted BPG image, related to a "type confusion" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5637` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 2.6
libav-tools - 2.6
libavcodec-extra - 2.6
libavcodec-extra57 - 2.6
libavcodec57 - 2.6
libavdevice57 - 2.6
libavfilter-extra - 2.6
libavfilter-extra6 - 2.6
libavfilter6 - 2.6
libavformat57 - 2.6
libavresample3 - 2.6
libavutil55 - 2.6
libpostproc54 - 2.6
libswresample2 - 2.6
libswscale4 - 2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6').
gst-libav1.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
